maml:description.maml:para: Returns a value selected by the user from an Enumeration type
When an enum type has been created to allow easy mapping of names to values, this function prompts the user to select one of the names, and returns the corresponding value.
The Enumeration type to used to build the selection list
The Value returned if nothing is selected from the list (if not specified the function will return null)
The Enumeration type to used to build the selection list
The Value returned if nothing is selected from the list (if not specified the function will return null)
Value of the selected item

dev:remarks.maml:para: The user is offered choices "Allow" or "Block" = 0 the two possible options in the fwAction (firewall action) enum, and the variable is set to 1 or 0, the associated values based on that choice.

maml:description.maml:para: Gives the descriptions for a value which is made from multiple enum values
An enum may contain values 1,2,4,8 etc and a value might be 13, meaning "This object has the properties represented by 1,4 and 8". Expand-EnumType converts 13 into the 3 property names
The Enumeration type, this can be passed as a string without the [] symbols.
The Value to be expanded
The Enumeration type, this can be passed as a string without the [] symbols.
The Value to be expanded
An integer
The description(s) for the input Integer

dev:remarks.maml:para: If FWProfileType has been defined as an Enum representing Firewall profiles, this will return the name(s) of the current profile type(s).

maml:description.maml:para: Returns an object selected by the user from a table of numbered rows.

Takes a collection of objects and the list of properties to be displayed. This is used to show a table with numbered rows. The user is prompted to make either a single or multiple choice, by row numbers and the selected objects are returned.
An array of objects which provide the data for the selection list. The data returned comes from this parameter as well. If a single item is provided, it is returned without showing the list.
One or more property names used to format the selection list.
Specifies that multiple items can be selected.
An array of objects which provide the data for the selection list. The data returned comes from this parameter as well. If a single item is provided, it is returned without showing the list.
One or more property names used to format the selection list.
Specifies that multiple items can be selected.
Returns a zero-based integer indicating the user's selection from a list
A list of choices is displayed one after the other, and the users selection is returned as a zero-based integer. Can display a caption followed by a message before the choices
An array of strings, where each one is possible choice. The hot key in each choice must be prefixed with an & sign
A caption to appear above the choices.
A Message to appear between caption and the choices
The item to be selected by default
A hash table where each item is a possible choice. The name part is the text to display as the choice label, and the Value part is the Help text
A caption to appear above the choices.
A Message to appear between caption and the choices
The item to be selected by default
An array of strings, each one is possible choice. The hot key in each choice must be prefixed with an & sign
A hash table where each item is a possible choice. The name part is the text to display as the choice label, and the Value part is the Help text
A caption to appear above the choices
A Message to appear between caption and the choices
The item to be selected by default
An integer indicating the selection

command:example.maml:title: --------------- Example 1 ------------------------
command:example.dev:code: select-item -Caption "Configuring RemoteDesktop" -Message "Do you want to: " -choice " &Disable Remote Desktop","&Enable Remote Desktop","&Cancel" -default 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: [D] Disable Remote Desktop [E] Enable Remote Desktop [C] Cancel [?] Help (default is "E"):
The function accepts D, E ,or C as input and returns 0 for Disable, 1 for Enable and 2 for Cancel

command:example.maml:title: --------------- Example 2 ------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-choice @{"&Tea"="A drink made from leaves";"&Coffee"="A drink made from beans"}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Pressing ? will produce help as follows
T - A drink made from leaves
C - A drink made from beans

maml:description.maml:para: Outputs objects in a tree format
The function takes a collection of objects which must have a property to display (label), a property identify the position in the tree (path) and a property which identifies a node's parent (parent).
The collection of items to output in the tree
The first item in the branch of the tree to output
The name of the property name which identifies a location in the tree. It does not need to be a fully qualified path, but must be unique
The name of the property which holds the path of a node's parent.
The name of the property which holds the text to display
The function is called recursively and this parameter specifies how far each branch of the tree is indented.
The collection of items to output in the tree
The first item in the branch of the tree to output
The name of the property name which identifies a location in the tree. It does not need to be a fully qualified path, but must be unique.
The value of the path property which identifies a node's parent.
The name of the property which holds the text to display
The function is called recursively and this parameter specifies how far each branch of the tree is indented. It is intended for internal use only.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Outputs a tree of subfolders of the current folder, the starting item is the current folder, and the path for each item is the PsPath property, its parent is in the PsParentPath propery. The name property is output

maml:description.maml:para: Allows the user to select from objects in a tree format
The function takes a collection of objects which must have a property to display (label), a property identify the position in the tree (path) and a property which identifies a node's parent (parent).
The collection of items to output in the tree
The first item in the branch of the tree to output
The name of the property name which identifies a location in the tree. It does not need to be a fully qualified path, but must be unique
The name of the property which holds the path of a node's parent.
The name of the property which holds the text to display
The function is called recursively and this parameter specifies how far each branch of the tree is indented.
Determines whether a single or multiple selection is to made from the tree
The collection of items to output in the tree
The first item in the branch of the tree to output
The name of the property name which identifies a location in the tree. It does not need to be a fully qualified path, but must be unique.
The value of the path property which identifies a node's parent.
The name of the property which holds the text to display
The function is called recursively and this parameter specifies how far each branch of the tree is indented. It is intended for internal use only.
Determines whether a single or multiple selection is to made from the tree
Checks to see if the current session has administrator privileges
Checks to see if the current session has administrator privileges
$true if the session was started as administrator

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns true if the session was started as administrator, false otherwise

maml:description.maml:para: Converts a logical disk index to a drive letter.
Converts a logical disk index to a drive letter.
An integer representing the index of the logical disk
A WMI object representing a physical disk
An integer representing the index of the logical disk
A WMI object representing a physical disk

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the drive letters of the partitions on the specified disk. For Example C:, D:

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a CHAR indicating the first avaialable drive letter.
Returns a CHAR indicating the first avaialable drive letter.
First available drive letter
